ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Provides a time input widget for Shiny. This widget allows intuitive time input in the '[hh]:[mm]:[ss]' or '[hh]:[mm]' (24H) format by using a separate numeric input for each time component. The interface with R uses date-time objects. See the project page for more information and examples.

Provides a time input widget for Shiny. This widget allows intuitive time input in the '[hh]:[mm]:[ss]' or '[hh]:[mm]' (24H) format by using a separate numeric input for each time component. The interface with R uses date-time objects. See the project page for more information and examples.

name: r-shinytime
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.0.3' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-shinytime
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/shinyTime_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/shinyTime/shinyTime_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: ff41c8909ac0080cbcc56e80a7e9e1dec1f1a2a46c0c9a148d3c867b5dc27713

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-htmltools
    - r-shiny
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-htmltools
    - r-shiny

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('shinyTime')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('shinyTime')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://burgerga.github.io/shinyTime/, https://github.com/burgerga/shinyTime
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: Provides a time input widget for Shiny. This widget allows intuitive time input in
    the '[hh]:[mm]:[ss]' or '[hh]:[mm]' (24H) format by using a separate numeric input
    for each time component. The interface with R uses date-time objects. See the project
    page for more information and examples.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
